name: WML-Wireless-Markup-Language-syntax
description:
I found no syntax script for wml so I made a simple one.

It was made for WML 1.1. Other WML versions weren't taken into account, but I believe this file is very easy to change.
install_details:
Go to the vim syntax directory.
Backup a wml.vim you might have, probably it stands for Website META Language, then put this one. Tada!

But to get things nice, edit menu.vim in vim's path, and replace:
Website\ MetaLanguage
with:
Wireless\ Markup\ Language
Or simply, in a command:
:%s/Website\\ MetaLanguage/Wireless\\ Markup\\ Language/
